title: (x) Roland Kirk - Melior {Mark S}
content:
This sample was sent to me for an ID. I think the bowl shapes remind me of Zapf (like Meilor or Palatino), but I can't place the face. The 'S' seems like it would be a good clue, but no 'slab' serifs matched it where I looked.   
   
Anyone recognize it? Thanks. ![RolandKirk sample](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410012724im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/23948.gif)

 [‹ (x) Banana Republic Typeface - TF Arrow {Mark S}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410012724/http:/www.typophile.com/node/2662 "Go to previous forum topic") [Konami ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410012724/http:/www.typophile.com/node/2663 "Go to next forum topic")
author: bowfinpw

comments.content: You were on the right track. It's Melior Bold Condensed. I don't think it's available in digital format, though.
Thanks Mark. So it is (found a picture in the Jaspert Encyclopaedia). The l.c. 'r' fooled me, because it's different than normal Melior 'r'.

Reminds me a bit of Miles Newlyn's [Verona](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410012724/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/870.html?1037012991). Some   
more alternatives were listed in [this thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410012724/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/7259.html).

It was almost a trick question the way Mike first put it. I was   
thinking, "if it's not Melior, what could it be?" At first I   
though Dominante, but that was not even close. Then, for   
some reason, I looked at Melior (in the Jaspert encyclopedia,   
of course). It's odd that Bold Condensed was never   
digitized.
